{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3341946,"name":"Dhruv","username":"diegoverma","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/diegoverma/{size}/220788_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T18:23:37.933Z","cooked":"

Could the Mk5 swerve module be released soon or is such an event possible within the year, or is there any work being done on it?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T18:23:37.933Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1301,"reads":1390,"readers_count":1389,"score":6783.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459920,"topic_slug":"mk5","display_username":"Dhruv","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65310,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/mk5/459920/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3341950,"name":"Pizzatc","username":"Pizzatc","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pizzatc/{size}/207342_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T18:29:52.883Z","cooked":"

There was discussion on FUN about the possibility of a Mk5 Module, while I think they said it was in the works, I personally don’t think theres a huge need for it right now. The Mk4’s have been serving teams well overall and there’s no huge need change to them. There have some been some minor updates such as an updated intermediate shaft, changing 8-32 to 10-32 bolts, etc. However I don’t think a new module is needed for awhile so it might be a couple years before a new module.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T18:59:01.759Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":1383,"readers_count":1382,"score":486.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459920,"topic_slug":"mk5","display_username":"Pizzatc","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":14}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54022,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2659"},"post_url":"/t/mk5/459920/2","custom_user_title":"2659","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":13},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":14,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3341964,"name":"Hadi","username":"Mohadi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mohadi/{size}/220984_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T18:59:54.098Z","cooked":"

I don’t think that an upgrade is necessary for Mkl4 swerve drives. If the Mk5 modules are ready for release, I would like to see a better solution for the loosening of long motor mounting screws where they generally need maintenance after each match.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T18:59:54.098Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":1311,"readers_count":1310,"score":282.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":459920,"topic_slug":"mk5","display_username":"Hadi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53263,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/mk5/459920/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3341965,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T19:00:24.762Z","cooked":"

I suspect there will be some considerations to decrease the size of modules or otherwise create more adventurous mounting options with future major releases (i.e. maximize under the bumper intake size, reduce footprint like WCPs swerve XS, etc) .

I also suspect things will hold steady with small upgrades and no major releases for a few years while FIRST tweaks bumper / motor rules. (Small feature changes for durability, maintenance, or versatility)

Just my 2 cents on what I see as the overall market space looking like.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T19:02:42.305Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":1233,"readers_count":1232,"score":376.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459920,"topic_slug":"mk5","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/mk5/459920/4","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3341975,"name":"MrBasse","username":"MrBasse","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrbasse/{size}/65032_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T19:20:38.673Z","cooked":"

After seeing 2767 up close after a few years of not being able to really get a good look, I’d like to see a COTS inline module at some point. Not sure the is enough interest to pursue it, but I always liked how much space is left in the center of the belly for other items or game piece travel.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T19:20:38.673Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":1100,"readers_count":1099,"score":380.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459920,"topic_slug":"mk5","display_username":"MrBasse","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":10}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16614,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC #3572"},"post_url":"/t/mk5/459920/5","custom_user_title":"FRC #3572","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":10}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":10,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3341984,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T19:43:31.869Z","cooked":"

From my limited chit chatting with them this year, absolutely, loads of space proportionally.

Years like this, where packaging can really matter, is possibly the last bastion of custom swerve.

As far as cots are concerned… market place seems pretty saturated. The design is pretty open source though and has been simplifying over the years (see Average Joes) Should be easy to pull off with access to a router (or send-cut-send/fabworks), higher quality 3d printing and a few months over the off season. Perhaps @Sam_Dare or @Mark_Wasserman could comment on manufacturing and time requirements.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T19:49:16.508Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":1023,"readers_count":1022,"score":249.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459920,"topic_slug":"mk5","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/3620-off-season-custom-swerve/447713","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"3620 off-season custom swerve","clicks":100}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":16614,"username":"MrBasse","name":"MrBasse","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrbasse/{size}/65032_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/mk5/459920/6","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3341993,"name":"MrBasse","username":"MrBasse","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrbasse/{size}/65032_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T19:59:56.678Z","cooked":"

Agree 100%, but it would be nice on day one to be able to just pick your form factor and build without having to machine parts or wait for them to arrive. We love our MK4i’s, but I would totally buy an inline version of it was available. We could probably make them ourselves or send out to have plates cut, but the time factor for us is a big one.

If there is a Mk5, I really hope SDS increases the size of the bearings.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T21:21:41.201Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":803,"readers_count":802,"score":165.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459920,"topic_slug":"mk5","display_username":"Dhruv","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":56747,"username":"Ege","name":"Ege","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ege/{size}/220985_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65310,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/mk5/459920/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3342090,"name":"","username":"LPryor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T22:32:30.968Z","cooked":"

We’d love to see smaller modules. The small footprint of the REV modules is attractive. We just have a large investment in SDS at this point.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T22:32:30.968Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":763,"readers_count":762,"score":192.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459920,"topic_slug":"mk5","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance"},"post_url":"/t/mk5/459920/11","custom_user_title":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3342093,"name":"Richard Wallace","username":"Richard_Wallace","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/richard_wallace/{size}/110760_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T22:43:02.221Z","cooked":"
Skyehawk:

(see Average Joes )

3620 is getting better at many aspects of FIRST — see also 2024 MISJO Impact.

Historically, their strong suit has been the drive-it, break-it, fix-it learning loop. This season they have targeted that skill on a derivative of 2767 swerve. This comes after four seasons running SDS modules. I expect the next generation to be a step up in robustness.

This game provides ample opportunities to whack the heck out of your robot.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T22:43:02.221Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":738,"readers_count":737,"score":152.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459920,"topic_slug":"mk5","display_username":"Richard Wallace","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1549,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I live for the details."},"post_url":"/t/mk5/459920/12","custom_user_title":"I live for the details.","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3342095,"name":"Jared Van Horn","username":"CuteRedpandas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cuteredpandas/{size}/243322_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T22:44:20.499Z","cooked":"
MrBasse:

inline module

out of curiosity, what is an inline module?

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T22:44:20.499Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":704,"readers_count":703,"score":175.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":459920,"topic_slug":"mk5","display_username":"Jared Van Horn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51417,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alum/NJIT Student"},"post_url":"/t/mk5/459920/13","custom_user_title":"Alum/NJIT Student","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3342097,"name":"Richard Wallace","username":"Richard_Wallace","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/richard_wallace/{size}/110760_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T22:47:28.392Z","cooked":"
CuteRedpandas:

inline module

They hug the side rail. Makes it easier to arrange mechanisms low in the robot, especially intakes and gamepiece paths.

Instead of the motors being jammed into the corner of the bot in a triangle they are placed in one skinny line on each side. In the case of this season it makes it easier to make a large width under the bumper intake

For your viewing pleasure.

Straight vs. Angled.

image856×725 95.7 KB

image905×632 84.2 KB

I’m not convinced about how much space saving there is here. (4.5" x 10.875" and 6.8" x 8.4") especially when compared to something the size of the REV module. Belt drive tends to eat up space. Truth be known I haven’t done a true size/space claim analysis.

Skyehawk:

@Mark_Wasserman could comment on manufacturing and time requirements.

There’s nothing faster than purchasing a module buuuuttt… if you are someone who likes to make your own:

Everything in the design that is black and not a purchased component is printed out of Onyx/ NylonX including the wheel and saddle with the exception of the bushing which is machined Delrin. The saddle has continuous carbon fiber for stiffness which is a MarkForged printer exclusive thing. The Joe’s are running a saddle without CF and I haven’t heard of a problem yet.

The plate is routed out of .250 aluminum 6061. The only secondary operation is boring the bushing hole to true it up for that oh so sweet fit.

The drive shaft is an 8mm from Mcmaster Carr with a KHK pinion welded to it and a Thrifty ring gear.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2024-03-25T00:49:52.033Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":656,"readers_count":655,"score":196.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":459920,"topic_slug":"mk5","display_username":"Mark Wasserman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30473,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Not fast swerve, but good swerve driven quickly"},"post_url":"/t/mk5/459920/18","custom_user_title":"Not fast swerve, but good swerve driven quickly","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3342203,"name":"MrBasse","username":"MrBasse","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrbasse/{size}/65032_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-25T01:04:30.648Z","cooked":"
Mark_Wasserman:

I’m not convinced about how much space saving there is here. (4.5" x 10.875" and 6.8" x 8.4") especially when compared to something the size of the REV module.

It’s not so much how much space you save as much as it is where you use space. After seeing your layout I can think of at least a half dozen things we could change if we had that extra few inches in-between modules. Beautiful machine as always.
